00036 NTee::NTee( const Settings& s ) : s_(s), Lsock_(0), Rsock_(0) 
00037 {

00057 void NTee::childExited( int sig )
00058 {
00059    int status;
00060    pid_t pid = wait(&status);
00061    
00062    int exitWith = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00063    
00064    // We can't shutdown the Lsock_ socket, even though we know that the R
00065    // side won't be communicating anymore, because there still could be stuff
00066    // left on the R socket to read... and send.  But it should be returning
00067    // EOF real soon.
00068    
00069    // returns control to where we were.  If we are in a read, it will have
00070    // to handle EINTR errno.
00071 }

00086 void NTee::startChildProc() {
00087 
00088    //** Replace any @NTEEPORT values in R_cmd with the actual port number
00089    char** ptr = &s_.R_cmd[1];
00090    while( *ptr ) {
00091       if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEEPORT" ) == 0 )
00092          snprintf( *ptr, 9,"%d",srvPort_);
00093       else if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEESERVERHOSTADDR" ) == 0 )
00094          snprintf( *ptr, 19, serverip_.c_str());
00095       else if ( strcmp( *ptr, "@NTEESERVERHOSTNAME" ) == 0 )
00096          snprintf( *ptr, 19, serverhost_.c_str());
00097 
00098       ++ptr;
00099    }
00100 
00101    //** Start the client.
00102    pid_t pid;
00103    if ( (pid=fork()) == 0 ) {
00104       // in the child.
00105       SysErrIf( execvp( s_.R_cmd[0], s_.R_cmd ) == -1 );
00106    }
00107    SysErrIf( pid == -1 ).info("Unable to fork properly\n");
00108    
00109    //** trap the SIGCHLD which will be queued to us if the client dies and
00110    //** cause the program to collect the child process with wait.
00111    UnixSignalHub::trap(SIGCHLD, boost::bind( &NTee::childExited, this, _1 ));
00112 }

00124 Socket* NTee::constructService( )
00125 {
00126    Socket* svc = new TCPSocket("Service");
00127    serverhost_ = "localhost";
00128    serverip_ = "127.0.0.1";
00129    srvPort_ = s_.srv_port;
00130    IPAddress ipaddr( serverhost_.c_str(), srvPort_ );   
00131    svc->listenOn(ipaddr);
00132 std::cerr << "Ntee service listening on: " << ipaddr.getPort() << "\n";
00133    srvPort_ = ipaddr.getPort();
00134    return svc;
00135 }

00144 void NTee::startListening()
00145 {
00146    int rc=0;
00147    fd_set rd_fds;
00148    int max = std::max(Lsock_->getFD(),Rsock_->getFD());
00149 
00150    // force both L and R sockets to be non-blocking IO.
00151    fcntl(Lsock_->getFD(), F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00152    fcntl(Rsock_->getFD(), F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00153       
00154    FD_ZERO(&rd_fds);
00155    FD_SET(Lsock_->getFD(), &rd_fds);
00156    FD_SET(Rsock_->getFD(), &rd_fds);
00157    
00158    std::string msg;
00159    char buf[1024];
00160    
00161    try_again:
00162    while( (rc=select(max+1, &rd_fds, 0, 0, 0)) > 0 ) {
00163          
00164       if ( FD_ISSET( Lsock_->getFD(), &rd_fds ) )
00165          transfer(*Lsock_,*Rsock_);
00166          
00167       if ( FD_ISSET( Rsock_->getFD(), &rd_fds ) )
00168          transfer(*Rsock_,*Lsock_);
00169       
00170       FD_ZERO(&rd_fds);
00171       FD_SET(Lsock_->getFD(), &rd_fds);
00172       FD_SET(Rsock_->getFD(), &rd_fds);
00173       
00174    }
00175    if ( rc == -1 && errno == EINTR ) {
00176       goto try_again;    // SIGCHLD came in, but there could be still some
00177                          // data left to read. Goto's are bad form, but here
00178                          // we get a lot less code for using it.
00179    }
00180    
00181 }

00194 void NTee::transfer( const Socket& from, const Socket& to )
00195 {
00196    char* buf = 0;
00197    size_t len = read_n( from.getFD(), &buf );
00198    boost::shared_ptr<char> ptr( buf, free );
00199 
00200    if ( len > 0 )
00201       write_n( to.getFD(), buf, len );
00202    else
00203       close(from.getFD());
00204 
00205    alertRecorders(from, to, buf, len);
00206 }

00224 void NTee::alertRecorders(const Socket& from, const Socket& to, 
00225                           const char* buf, 
00226                           size_t len)
00227 {
00228    RecCont_t::iterator iter= recorders_.begin();
00229    for( ; iter != recorders_.end(); ++iter ) {
00230       (*iter)->record(from, to, buf, len);
00231    }
00232 }

00249 int NTee::start()
00250 {
00251    //** Build up the service port.
00252    Socket* svc = constructService();
00253    
00254    //** Not going to accept yet! Instead, we start the client.
00255    startChildProc();
00256          
00257    // Back in the parent (ntee) otherwise we'd have exited.
00258    SysErrIf( (Rsock_=svc->accept("R")) == 0 );
00259    svc->close();
00260    delete svc;
00261       
00262    // Report the client connection.
00263 //   char buf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
00264 //   inet_ntop(AF_INET, &addr, buf, sizeof(addr));   
00265 //   std::cout << "Client connection: " << buf
00266 //             << ":" << ntohs(addr.sin_port) << "\n";
00267    
00268    //** R process has connected... time to connect to the L process.
00269    int type = (s_.protocol==Settings::TCP)? SOCK_STREAM : SOCK_DGRAM;   
00270    IPAddress lip( s_.L_host_ip.c_str(), s_.L_port.c_str());
00271    SysErrIf( Lsock_->connectTo(lip) == -1 );                       
00272    std::cout << "NTee connected to L side: " << s_.L_host_ip << ":"
00273              << s_.L_port << "\n";
00274    
00275    //** Start listening to both sides and passing the information.
00276    startListening();
00277    
00278    //** shut down all recorders
00279    std::for_each( recorders_.begin(), recorders_.end(),
00280                   boost::bind(&Recorder::shutdown, _1));
00281    
00282    return 0;
00283 }
